patho.title: CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE
patho.description: Cardiovascular diseases [CVD] are a group disorders related to heart and blood vessels. There are different types of CVD which are the leading causes of death globally.
patho.types: Types: Coronary heart diseases, Rheumatic heart diseases and Congenital heart diseases.
patho.symptom: Symptoms: Pain and discomfort of chest, left upper extremity, Severe headache, Fainting, Sweating and Difficulty in speech.
patho.cause: Cause: Hypertension, Smoking, High blood cholesterol, Overweight.
patho.treatment: Treatment: Blood thinning medicine, Beta blockers, Bypass surgery, Stunts.

patho.title: CORONA VIRUS
patho.description: Corona virus disease also called COVID-19 is an infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus. This has caused a worldwide crisis causing numerous deaths. It also caused economic crisis. This outbreak began in Wuhan, China in December 2019.
patho.types: Types: Alpha, Beta, Delta, and Omicron.
patho.symptom: Symptoms: Fever, Cold, Cough, Difficulty in breathing and Fatigue along with body ache.
patho.cause: Cause: It is a contagious disease which has wide spread through infected person’s close contact. It is caused due SARS-Cov-2 virus.
patho.treatment: Treatment: The complete cure is yet to be discovered but vaccines and booster doses have been provided.

patho.title: PARKINSON'S DISEASE
patho.description: Parkinson’s disease [PD] or simply Parkinson’s is a chronic degenerative disorder of the central nervous system that mainly affects the motor system.
patho.types: Types: Idiopathic Parkinson's, Vascular parkinsonism and Drug-induced parkinsonism.
patho.symptom: Symptoms: Tremor, Slowness of movement, Difficulty in walking, Speaking and Anxiety.
patho.cause: Cause: The cause of PD is generally unknown but a combination of genetic and environmental factors are believed to play a major role.
patho.treatment: Treatment: PD is non-curable disease but is controlled by medications. Usually Levodopa medication is given to these patients.

patho.title: RENAL DISORDERS
patho.description: Renal disorders are related to the disfunctioning or abnormalities of kidney. This may include renal failure, calculus, transplantation or even congenital anomalies.
patho.symptom: Symptoms: Weight loss with poor appetite, Swollen ankles, feet and hands, Tiredness and Blood in urine.
patho.cause: Cause: Diabetes, High blood pressure, Smoking, Drinking and Obesity.
patho.treatment: Treatment: Lifestyle changes, Dialysis and Transplantation

patho.title: ALZHEIMER’S DISEASE
patho.description: Alzheimer’s is a neurodegenerative disease t usually starts slowly and progressively worsens. It is a brain disorder which slowly destroys the memory and thinking skills of the patient along with destroying the ability to carry out the simplest tasks.
patho.symptom: Symptoms: Memory loss problems, Language disorientation and Mood swings.
patho.cause: Cause: The proper cause is barely known but according to suspects it might be due to protein failed function, abnormal amount of amyloid beta, genetic variations.
patho.treatment: Treatment: It is non-curable disease which is controlled and maintained by certain memory boosting activities, medications
